messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] North Carolina?
messages.msgSnippet: wrote: Is anyone here in NC?  We re near the Triad (Greensboro/HP/W-S).  I d *love* to find some other teen
messages.messageBody:
<<<<Melinda <melindav98@...> wrote:
Is anyone here in NC? We're near the Triad (Greensboro/HP/W-S). I'd
*love* to find some other teen homeschoolers/unschoolers nearby! The
only two support groups/homeschool groups in our immediate area are a
little tooooooo religious for my liking and we can't possibly ever
"measure up" if you know what I mean. We're not athiest or anything -
I was raised Southern Baptist - but I'm not comfortable with our
homeschooling revolving solely around religion. </end babble>

So - anyone in NC?? :)>>>


I'm Tracy and I'm in NC {and I do happen to be non-Christian - but that's beside the point <g>} near the Durham area, but my kids are younger {oldest being almost 10}. So your not alone in NC. There are many in the same boat as you are. Which is why we just started a new statewide group in January, that is a bit in contrast to NCHE and we welcome everyone from all walks. No statement of faith to join. We encourage diversity so you may find some homeschoolers around you. {Check out my signature - LOL)

Tracy Merritt ~ ha-nc-tracy@...
HA-NC Newsletter Editor
Homeschool Alliance of North Carolina,
a different type of group, we really want
our members to be active participants.
After all, we put the ALL in ALLiance
http://www.ha-nc.org/

---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?
The New Yahoo! Search - Faster. Easier. Bingo.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] North Carolina?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/30/03 1:23:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... You should check out the Lunch Bunch Learners.  They are a secular group.  I believe
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/30/03 1:23:50 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
melindav98@... writes:

> Is anyone here in NC? We're near the Triad (Greensboro/HP/W-S

You should check out the Lunch Bunch Learners. They are a secular group. I
believe unschooling. I think Greensboro is where they are located. There
are a couple of NC lists. NCSecular and NCLOOP both through yahoo. You
could post there for more specifics. We live in Valdese, near Hickory. I
was thinking NCSecular had at least one person from the Lunch Bunch on it.
All I know about them is that they do have a play group that meets regularly.
Pam G.

messages.subject: North Carolina?
messages.msgSnippet: Is anyone here in NC?  We re near the Triad (Greensboro/HP/W-S).  I d *love* to find some other teen homeschoolers/unschoolers nearby!  The only two support
messages.messageBody:
Is anyone here in NC? We're near the Triad (Greensboro/HP/W-S). I'd
*love* to find some other teen homeschoolers/unschoolers nearby! The
only two support groups/homeschool groups in our immediate area are a
little tooooooo religious for my liking and we can't possibly ever
"measure up" if you know what I mean. We're not athiest or anything -
I was raised Southern Baptist - but I'm not comfortable with our
homeschooling revolving solely around religion. </end babble>

So - anyone in NC?? :)
